title: Super cup
text:
A Super cup is a competition, usually but not exclusively in <a href="association%20football">association football</a>, which often forms the ’<a href="Curtain%20raiser%20%28drama%29">curtain-raiser</a>’ to a season. It is typically contested on a national level by two competition winners of the previous season: the knock-out cup winner and the league winner. There are also continental super cups, like the <a href="UEFA%20Super%20Cup">UEFA Super Cup</a> in football, which puts together winners of the top- and second-tier UEFA competitions. Sometimes these are <a href="two-legged%20tie">two-legged tie</a>s, with a match played at each side's stadium, but increasingly they are one-off fixtures at a neutral venue, such as a <a href="national%20stadium">national stadium</a>. Some Super Cups have even been staged in venues outside their home country, such as the Italian, French, Spanish, Turkish, Mexican, and Egyptian games. 
If the league champions are <a href="Double%20%28association%20football%29">also the national cup winners</a>, they may play the runners-up from one of the competitions.
Football.
National super cups.
The following nations have an active super cup competition:
Continental super cups.
Some continental football federations also have their own super cups:
Intercontinental super cups.
Most of the continental football confederations have jointly held a competition pitting their champions against each other: 
All of these competitions are now defunct and have been succeeded by the <a href="FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a>, which features the champions of all of the confederations, plus the champion of the host country. In 2017, FIFA retroactively recognised the winners of the European/South American Cup as world champions.
A similar tournament was held at international level, the <a href="FIFA%20Confederations%20Cup">FIFA Confederations Cup</a>. It was initially held on a biennial basis, every odd year, from 1993 until 2005 when it became quadrennial, the year before a <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">World Cup</a> in its host country. It featured the six continental champions, the World Cup winners and the host. The <a href="2017%20FIFA%20Confederations%20Cup">2017 FIFA Confederations Cup</a> was the 10th and last Confederations Cup before FIFA abolished it for an <a href="Future%20FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup%20%28China%29">expanded Club World Cup</a>.
Other tournaments like this have been held, including the <a href="Suruga%20Bank%20Championship">Suruga Bank Championship</a> (pitting the <a href="Copa%20Sudamericana">Copa Sudamericana</a> and <a href="J.League%20Cup">J.League Cup</a> winners), the <a href="Copa%20de%20Oro">Copa de Oro</a> (pitting all the most recent CONMEBOL competition winners), and the <a href="Copa%20Iberoamericana">Copa Iberoamericana</a> (pitting the <a href="Copa%20de%20Oro">Copa de Oro</a> and <a href="Copa%20del%20Rey">Copa del Rey</a> winners.
